He has been painting American flags for 30 some odd years and is a political activist who has been repeatedly arrested for his work. Bizarrely, he still does thin blue line copaganda among his artwork! His mom (deceased) is interviewed a bit and doesn't agree with his politics, and I'm not sure I do either, but it's a decent watch and Scott is definitely a character! After the credits there is a five minute or so Q&A too. I was the ONLY person in the theater for this.#movie #review #spoilers #TheRelentlessPatriot #ScottLoBaido

records.text: Lisp Machines, for example, which RMS lost his shit over, and started the FSF and GNU, with some who claim he basically took their code and reworked it, poorly.Like, Lisp Machines? They were open source. Symbolics, which perhaps is now mostly only remembered as being the first ".com" domain in 1985, was derived from the CADR research computing at MIT, but even though it was commercial, it shipped with complete source code, down to the microcode.Commerical open source is old.That does not mean it has done what FUTO seems to think it is "experimenting" with as far as providing a livelihood for open source programmers.Louis Rossmann was apparently born in 1988.Did he ever know about Symbolics? Those machines were insanely expensive and difficult to come by. I saw a copy of OpenGenera (basically, its OS) on CD-ROM sell for $5000 or so on eBay.

records.text: Lisp Machines, for example, which RMS lost his shit over, and started the FSF and GNU, with some who claim he basically took their code and reworked it, poorly.Like, Lisp Machines? They were open source. Symbolics, which perhaps is now mostly only remembered as being the first ".com" domain in 1985, was derived from the CADR research computing at MIT, but even though it was commercial, it shipped with complete source code, down to the microcode.Commerical open source is old.That does not mean it has done what FUTO seems to think it is "experimenting" with as far as providing a livelihood for open source programmers.Louis Rossmann was apparently born in 1988.Did he ever know about Symbolics? Those machines were insanely expensive and difficult to come by. I saw a copy of OpenGenera (basically, its OS) on CD-ROM sell for $5000 or so on eBay.

records.text: Lisp Machines, for example, which RMS lost his shit over, and started the FSF and GNU, with some who claim he basically took their code and reworked it, poorly.Like, Lisp Machines? Those machines were insanely expensive and difficult to come by. I saw a copy of OpenGenera (basically, its OS) on CD-ROM sell for $5000 or so on eBay.
